cms.pagetemplate.PageTemplateDescription: Allows user to relate the current node to another node based on the provided Relationship Name
cms.pagetemplate.PageTemplateLayout:
{^WebPartZone|(id)HeaderContentZone^}
{^WebPartZone|(id)NewButtonZone^}
{^WebPartZone|(id)AddRelationshipZone^}
{^WebPartZone|(id)RelationshipZone^}

properties.fielddescription: What is shown above the selector
Shown above the tool, useful to define what type of relationships are being selected or what this relationship affects.
If the Node is a Linked Document, will show relationships on the primary node instead of the linked node.
Check if you wish to allow an assignment of documents that is flipped from the normal Direction.
Anything below 0 means unlimited.

properties.explanationtext: Use CurrentDocument for the current document. ex: CurrentDocument.ClassName != "The.ClassName"
properties.fielddescription:
This macro will be evaluated to determine of a page can be on the "Left Side."
For Ad-hoc relationships, this determines if a page can have relationships added to it.

properties.explanationtext: Use CurrentDocument for the current document. ex: CurrentDocument.ClassName == "The.ClassName"
properties.fielddescription:
This macro will be evaluated to determine of a page can be on the "Right Side."
For Ad-hoc relationships, this determines if a page gets a "read only" view of the pages it's related to.

If checked, this tab will hide if the current page is neither Right Side or Left Side (based on the above macro conditions).
This only works if you apply the Tab Extender RelationshipsExtended.RelationshipVerticalTabExtender to the parent Vertical Tab UI Element.

properties.explanationtext: Will only be shown on Left-Side pages where Allow Switch Sides is disabled.
properties.fielddescription: If checked, a New page button will be available to the user to quickly add new pages if one isn't found.
Must select a single page type that will be created at the specified location.
The Node Alias Path of the parent where the new page should be placed.
If blank, all page types will be allowed

Can add a custom Display Name Format for the page elements. The Macro can use any field found in the CMS_Node, CMS_Document, and the Page Type Specific fields.
ex: {% NodeName %} - {% MyField %}

Can add a hover to the selectable page elements. The Macro can use any field found in the CMS_Node, CMS_Document, and the Page Type Specific fields.
ex: {% MyField %}

properties.explanationtext: Only CMS_Tree fields available for where condition
properties.fielddescription: Can apply an additional where condition to limit which items are selectable
Starting Node Alias Paths to display, each path on a new line.

properties.fieldcaption: Remove Sub Trees with No Selections
properties.fielddescription: If true, it will remove any sub trees that don't have any possible selections. Uncheck if you need to see the tree structure regardless if it has a selectable element.

settings.Options: Checkbox;Select Multiple then Add (Checkbox + Button) Individual;Add Individually

properties.fielddescription: If set, only objects which belong to specified site are retrieved (if the object has SiteID column). If null or empty, all objects are retrieved. Use #currentsite for CurrentSite and #global for global objects.
Determines the design and behavior of the selection dialog.

settings.Options: 0;Single text box 1;Single drop down list 2;Multiple 3;Multiple text box 4;Single button 5;Multiple button 6;Single transformation

properties.fielddescription: Specifies the names of columns that should be loaded with the objects of the specified data class (in addition to the columns required by default).

properties.explanationtext: Can be any CMS_Tree, CMS_Document, or your Allowed PageType fields.
properties.fielddescription: Columns also searched by, must be part of the Additional Columns, comma seperated
Sets the order of the items offered for selection via a standard ORDER BY clause. Applies to the multiple selection grid, dropdownlist, single and multiple selection dialogs.
Can be used to specify the name of the column that determines if the selected object is enabled.

The number of maximum displayed total items in the dropdownlist selection (excluding the special and generic items). The default value is 50. If exceeded, only the number of items set by the MaxDisplayedItems parameter will be displayed.

Sets the maximum number of displayed items in drop-down list mode (excluding the special and generic items). The default value is 25. If the number is exceeded, the remaining items can be selected through the (more..) option.
Default number of items displayed per page. Applies to the multiple selection grid, drop-down list, single and multiple selection dialogs. The default value is 25.
Sets the path to custom filter control.
If true, name filter is shown in dialog
Applies to the Page Uni Selector
Extension class for the Listing for Ad-Hoc relationships where the current node is the left node.
This applies only to Ad-Hoc relationships where the current node is on the right. Displays delete-only capabilities.
Extension class for the Listing for normal relationships.

webpart.property: Read Only Listing (Ad Hoc Right only)
